t: John 5
The Third Sign: Healing the Sick
After*p this, a Jewish festival took place, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
By the Sheep Gate in Jerusalem there is a pool, called Bethesda in Aramaic, which has five colonnades.
Within these lay a large number of the disabled - blind, lame, and paralyzed.
One*p man was there who had been disabled for thirty-eight years.
When Jesus saw him lying there and realized he had already been there a long time, he said to him, “Do*r you*r want*r to*r get*r well?”*r
“Sir,”*p the disabled man answered, “I have no one to put me into the pool when the water is stirred up, but while I’m coming, someone goes down ahead of me.”
“Get*rp up,”*r Jesus told him, “pick*r up*r your*r mat*r and*r walk.”*r
Instantly the man got well, picked up his mat, and started to walk. Now*p that day was the Sabbath,
and so the Jews said to the man who had been healed, “This is the Sabbath. The law prohibits you from picking up your mat.”
He*p replied, “The man who made me well told me, ‘Pick*r up*r your*r mat*r and*r walk.’”*r
“Who*p is this man who told you, ‘Pick*r up*r your*r mat*r and*r walk’?”*r they asked.
But the man who was healed did not know who it was, because Jesus had slipped away into the crowd that was there.
After*p this, Jesus found him in the temple and said to him, “See,*r you*r are*r well.*r Do*r not*r sin*r anymore,*r so*r that*r something*r worse*r doesn’t*r happen*r to*r you.”*r
The man went and reported to the Jews that it was Jesus who had made him well.
Therefore, the Jews began persecuting Jesus because he was doing these things on the Sabbath.
Honoring the Father and the Son
Jesus*p responded to them, “My*r Father*r is*r still*r working,*r and*r I*r am*r working*r also.”*r
This is why the Jews began trying all the more to kill him: Not only was he breaking the Sabbath, but he was even calling God his own Father, making himself equal to God.

Jesus*p replied, “Truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r the*r Son*r is*r not*r able*r to*r do*r anything*r on*r his*r own,*r but*r only*r what*r he*r sees*r the*r Father*r doing.*r For*r whatever*r the*r Father*r does,*r the*r Son*r likewise*r does*r these*r things.*r
For*r the*r Father*r loves*r the*r Son*r and*r shows*r him*r everything*r he*r is*r doing,*r and*r he*r will*r show*r him*r greater*r works*r than*r these*r so*r that*r you*r will*r be*r amazed.*r
And*r just*r as*r the*r Father*r raises*r the*r dead*r and*r gives*r them*r life,*r so*r the*r Son*r also*r gives*r life*r to*r whom*r he*r wants.*r
The*r Father,*r in*r fact,*r judges*r no*r one*r but*r has*r given*r all*r judgment*r to*r the*r Son,*r
so*r that*r all*r people*r may*r honor*r the*r Son*r just*r as*r they*r honor*r the*r Father.*r Anyone*r who*r does*r not*r honor*r the*r Son*r does*r not*r honor*r the*r Father*r who*r sent*r him.*r
Life and Judgment

“Truly*rp I*r tell*r you,*r anyone*r who*r hears*r my*r word*r and*r believes*r him*r who*r sent*r me*r has*r eternal*r life*r and*r will*r not*r come*r under*r judgment*r but*r has*r passed*r from*r death*r to*r life.*r
“Truly*rp I*r tell*r you,*r an*r hour*r is*r coming,*r and*r is*r now*r here,*r when*r the*r dead*r will*r hear*r the*r voice*r of*r the*r Son*r of*r God,*r and*r those*r who*r hear*r will*r live.*r
For*r just*r as*r the*r Father*r has*r life*r in*r himself,*r so*r also*r he*r has*r granted*r to*r the*r Son*r to*r have*r life*r in*r himself.*r
And*r he*r has*r granted*r him*r the*r right*r to*r pass*r judgment,*r because*r he*r is*r the*r Son*r of*r Man.*r
Do*r not*r be*r amazed*r at*r this,*r because*r a*r time*r is*r coming*r when*r all*r who*r are*r in*r the*r graves*r will*r hear*r his*r voice*r

and*r come*r out -*r those*r who*r have*r done*r good*r things,*r to*r the*r resurrection*r of*r life,*r but*r those*r who*r have*r done*r wicked*r things,*r to*r the*r resurrection*r of*r condemnation.*r

“I*rp can*r do*r nothing*r on*r my*r own.*r I*r judge*r only*r as*r I*r hear,*r and*r my*r judgment*r is just, because*r I*r do*r not*r seek*r my*r own*r will,*r but*r the*r will*r of*r him*r who*r sent*r me.*r
Witnesses to Jesus
“If*rp I*r testify*r about*r myself,*r my*r testimony*r is*r not*r true.*r
There*r is*r another*r who*r testifies*r about*r me,*r and*r I*r know*r that*r the*r testimony*r he*r gives*r about*r me*r is*r true.*r
You*r sent*r messengers*r to*r John,*r and*r he*r testified*r to*r the*r truth.*r
I*r don’t*r receive*r human*r testimony,*r but*r I*r say*r these*r things*r so*r that*r you*r may*r be*r saved.*r
John*r was*r a*r burning*r and*r shining*r lamp,*r and*r you*r were*r willing*r to*r rejoice*r for*r a*r while*r in*r his*r light.*r

“But*rp I*r have*r a*r greater*r testimony*r than*r John’s*r because*r of*r the*r works*r that*r the*r Father*r has*r given*r me*r to*r accomplish.*r These*r very*r works*r I*r am*r doing*r testify*r about*r me*r that*r the*r Father*r has*r sent*r me.*r
The*r Father*r who*r sent*r me*r has*r himself*r testified*r about*r me.*r You*r have*r not*r heard*r his*r voice*r at*r any*r time,*r and*r you*r haven’t*r seen*r his*r form.*r
You*r don’t*r have*r his*r word*r residing*r in*r you,*r because*r you*r don’t*r believe*r the*r one*r he*r sent.*r
You*r pore*r over*r the*r Scriptures*r because*r you*r think*r you*r have*r eternal*r life*r in*r them,*r and*r yet*r they*r testify*r about*r me.*r
But*r you*r are*r not*r willing*r to*r come*r to*r me*r so*r that*r you*r may*r have*r life.*r
“I*rp do*r not*r accept*r glory*r from*r people,*r
but*r I*r know*r you -*r that*r you*r have*r no*r love*r for*r God*r within*r you.*r
I*r have*r come*r in*r my*r Father’s*r name,*r and*r yet*r you*r don’t*r accept*r me.*r If*r someone*r else*r comes*r in*r his*r own*r name,*r you*r will*r accept*r him.*r
How*r can*r you*r believe,*r since*r you*r accept*r glory*r from*r one*r another*r but*r don’t*r seek*r the*r glory*r that*r comes*r from*r the*r only*r God?*r
Do*r not*r think*r that*r I*r will*r accuse*r you*r to*r the*r Father.*r Your*r accuser*r is*r Moses,*r on*r whom*r you*r have*r set*r your*r hope.*r
For*r if*r you*r believed*r Moses,*r you*r would*r believe*r me,*r because*r he*r wrote*r about*r me.*r
But*r if*r you*r don’t*r believe*r what*r he*r wrote,*r how*r will*r you*r believe*r my*r words?”*r
